intro: Carpesium hieracioides, commonly known as the common hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and is known for its aromatic properties. The plant is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory benefits.
